message: It would be cool to have a page like /project/contributors but for specific people. It would be something like /username/contributions and it would list all the open source contributions for a specific user.
+1, fits perfect for this thread: Exactly one thing you'd like to see added/improved on GitHub - https://convore.com/github/exactly-one-thing-youd-like-to-see-addedimproved-on-github/
+1 I was actually thinking about this just the other day
@defunkt I would start by fetching accepted pull requests to external repos, if you keep track of that. A list of those even without the specific commit would be enough.
@defunkt is there a way to see all commits of a tag via API?
@fyskij http://develop.github.com/p/commits.html see "Listing Commits on a Branch"
you can replace the branch with any git ref: a tag, a branch, or another commit

This would definitely rock for scouting recruits or pimping yourself -- it's probably stating the obvious in this thread but for these use cases browsing someone's profile page with a bunch of old stale forks and a limited recent activity stream is only so useful (or you actually clean up your forks and it's perhaps even less clear where you've contributed...). I can definitely see this involving some nasty batch reporting though for sure.
